str2: Then, therefore, since. Probably from airo; a particle denoting an inference more or less decisive.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To stand fast, stand firm, persevere. From the perfect tense of histemi; to be stationary, i.e. to persevere.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From kratos; to use strength, i.e. Seize or retain.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
An instruction, tradition. From paradidomi; transmission, i.e. a precept; specially, the Jewish traditionary law.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To teach, direct, admonish. A prolonged form of a primary verb dao; to teach.
And if, whether. From ei and te; if too.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
And if, whether. From ei and te; if too.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
A letter, dispatch, epistle, message. From epistello; a written message.
